activities: Sierra-Cedar, Inc. employs approximately 1000 individuals across the United States. The company, which falls into the computer industry sector collects information from the EU in the form of human resources (HR) data as well as marketing information from EU residents who sign up for whitepapers or surveys. The information collected as part of the HR processes is in accordance with federal employment law. The information collected as part of marketing activities is not sensitive information and is only used in conjunction with marketing activities. As part of Sierra-Cedar's services, including consulting, education, support, and hosting, some customers may allow Sierra-Cedar to maintain or be provided with access to EU data. In connection with those services, Sierra-Cedar does not control the data and any access to or use of such data is incidental to completing its contractual requirements for the customer.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
personaldata: Online, manually processed, and HR data
recoursemech: JAMS for non-HR Data; EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) for HR Data Only.
